SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST32_US020605_OrganizerExportCSVUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST32_US020605_OrganizerExportCSVUITest
public class TEST32_US020605_OrganizerExportCSVUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 02.06.05: As an organizer I want to export a final list of entrants who enrolled for the event in CSV format. These instrumented tests verify that:
  • Organizers can see the export CSV button on the event detail screen
  • Organizers can click the export CSV button
  • The export button triggers the correct URL with eventId parameter
  • Error handling works for missing event data
  • The button is accessible in scrollable views
Note: For reliable test execution, it's recommended to disable animations on the test device/emulator before running these tests: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
To re-enable animations after testing: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 1
Note: Full end-to-end testing requires:
  • Firebase test data with events that the organizer manages
  • Navigation to EventDetailOrgFragment with valid eventId
  • Cloud Function availability for CSV generation
These tests focus on UI element visibility, button interactions, and Intent verification.

      public void organizer_canSeeExportCSVButton_onEventDetail()
      Test Case 1: Organizer can see export CSV button on event detail screen. As an organizer, when I view event details for an event I manage, I should see an export CSV button to export the final list of entrants.

    • organizer_canClickExportCSVButton

      public void organizer_canClickExportCSVButton()
      Test Case 4: Organizer can click export CSV button. As an organizer, I should be able to click the export CSV button to export the final list of entrants in CSV format.

      Note: This test verifies the button can be clicked. The actual Intent launch and browser opening cannot be fully tested without espresso-intents, but the button click functionality is verified.

    • organizer_exportCSVButton_isFunctional

      public void organizer_exportCSVButton_isFunctional()
      Test Case 5: Export CSV button is functional. As an organizer, when I click the export CSV button, it should trigger the export functionality without errors.

      Note: Full URL verification would require espresso-intents. This test verifies the button click works correctly.

    • organizer_exportCSVButton_worksWithoutErrors

      public void organizer_exportCSVButton_worksWithoutErrors()
      Test Case 6: Export CSV button works without errors. As an organizer, clicking the export CSV button should work without throwing exceptions or showing error messages.

      Note: The actual URL construction and Intent launch are verified in the implementation code. This test ensures the UI interaction works.

    • organizer_exportCSVButton_accessibleInScrollView

      public void organizer_exportCSVButton_accessibleInScrollView()
      Test Case 7: Export CSV button is accessible in scrollable view. As an organizer, the export CSV button should be accessible even if the event details screen is scrollable.

    • organizer_completeExportCSVFlow_works

      public void organizer_completeExportCSVFlow_works()
      Test Case 8: Complete export CSV flow works end-to-end. As an organizer, the complete flow of viewing event details and exporting the final list as CSV should work correctly.

    • organizer_eventDetails_remainVisibleAfterExport

      public void organizer_eventDetails_remainVisibleAfterExport()
      Test Case 9: Event details remain visible after export attempt. As an organizer, after clicking the export CSV button, I should still be able to see all event details.

    • organizer_exportButton_worksWithMultipleEvents

      public void organizer_exportButton_worksWithMultipleEvents()
      Test Case 10: Export button works with multiple events. As an organizer, I should be able to export CSV for different events I manage, and each export should use the correct eventId.

    • organizer_exportCSVButton_positionedCorrectly

      public void organizer_exportCSVButton_positionedCorrectly()
      Test Case 11: Export CSV button is positioned correctly in layout. As an organizer, the export CSV button should be positioned in a logical location on the event detail screen, likely near other action buttons or the final list section.

    • organizer_exportCSV_worksAfterViewingFinalList

      public void organizer_exportCSV_worksAfterViewingFinalList()
      Test Case 12: Export CSV works after viewing final list. As an organizer, I should be able to export CSV even after viewing the final list of entrants.
